conclusion: Analyze forces acting on the block and plank to determine condition for F1.
Block is subject to weight, vertical force F2, friction force, and horizontal force F1.
Calculate weight of the block as 8.0 N.
F2 is applied upward by the second person.
Friction force opposes motion, acts downward, magnitude is mu*N.
F1 is applied horizontally to the left by the first person.
Plank is subject to weight, normal force from wall, normal force from block, and friction force.
Calculate weight of the plank as 4.0 N.
Normal force from wall acts horizontally to the right.
Normal force from block acts horizontally to the left.
Friction force acts horizontally to the left on the plank.
Normal force N is equal to F1.
Condition for upward motion is F2 > W + f.
Substitute values to get F2 > 8.0 + 0.20 F1.
Final condition for F1 is that F2 > 8.0 + 0.20 F1.
